title: Nissan Has a Ways to Catch Up
sub_head: The Japanese car maker’s underwhelming new electric-vehicle strategy highlights how far the wider industry has moved on while it focused on operational turnaround
body:
The bar is high these days for car makers announcing big-budget electric-vehicle strategies.
Nissan shares fell 5.6% Monday after the company said it would invest almost $18 billion over five years to accelerate its EV rollout. Other Japanese auto stocks also fell—the Tokyo market needed to catch up with Friday’s stock-market rout—but Nissan was hit harder than its peers. It only has been six months since Ford published a comparable EV strategy, eliciting a euphoric reaction from Wall Street, but the party has moved on.
